issue.title: hot fix failing browser builds on 0.2.25

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
closes #6110
added `AuroraDataApiPostgresDriver` to `BrowserDisabledDriversDummy.template` to fix typeorm not compiling when using browser target

body:
i made a PR to fix this: https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/pull/6117

@pleerock this issue makes all browser-builds fail on 0.2.25, maybe you want to consider a hot fix release for this.

issue.title: "TypeError: qa is not a function" when synchronizing with sql.js in the browser

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
**Issue type:**

[ ] question
[x] bug report
[ ] feature request
[ ] documentation issue

**Database system/driver:**

[ ] `cordova`
[ ] `mongodb`
[ ] `mssql`
[ ] `mysql` / `mariadb`
[ ] `oracle`
[ ] `postgres`
[ ] `cockroachdb`
[ ] `sqlite`
[x] `sqljs` (version `1.3.0`)
[ ] `react-native`
[ ] `expo`

**TypeORM version:**

[ ] `latest`
[ ] `@next`
[x] `0.2.24` (I can't go to `latest`, because it currently doesn't work in the browser, see #6110)

**Steps to reproduce or a small repository showing the problem:**

I'm calling `connection.synchronize(true)` to drop the database and re-synchronize it in my app, but when I do this, I get this error for every table I defined in my app:
```
query:  PRAGMA foreign_keys = OFF;
PlatformTools.js:102 query:  BEGIN TRANSACTION
PlatformTools.js:102 query:  SELECT 'DROP VIEW "' || name || '";' as query FROM "sqlite_master" WHERE "type" = 'view'
PlatformTools.js:102 query:  SELECT 'DROP TABLE "' || name || '";' as query FROM "sqlite_master" WHERE "type" = 'table' AND "name" != 'sqlite_sequence'
PlatformTools.js:102 query:  BEGIN TRANSACTION
PlatformTools.js:102 query:  DROP TABLE "my_table";

PlatformTools.js:105 query failed:  DROP TABLE "my_table";
PlatformTools.js:105 error:  TypeError: qa is not a function
    at Mu (sql-asm.js:127)
    at Fu (sql-asm.js:115)
    at Ku (sql-asm.js:127)
    at Array.rs (sql-asm.js:103)
    at tb (sql-asm.js:103)
    at ql (sql-asm.js:103)
    at im (sql-asm.js:103)
    at Va (sql-asm.js:103)
    at e._sqlite3_step (sql-asm.js:216)
    at a.step (sql-asm.js:79)
```

It is fixed but no new release yet.

issue.title: Next.js build error

labels.name: help-needed
labels.description: The maintainer needs help due to time constraint/missing knowledge

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
I'm getting a build error in my nextjs app. When running `next build` I end up getting this output.
```sh
$ next build
info  - Loaded env from /Users/alex/code/my-project/.env
> [PWA] Compile client (static)
> [PWA] Auto register service worker with: /Users/alex/code/my-project/node_modules/next-pwa/register.js
> [PWA] Service worker: /Users/alex/code/my-project/public/sw.js
> [PWA]   url: /sw.js
> [PWA]   scope: /
> [PWA] Compile server
> Using external babel configuration
> Location: "/Users/alex/code/my-project/.babelrc"
Creating an optimized production build  
Failed to compile.

./node_modules/typeorm/browser/driver/DriverFactory.js
Attempted import error: 'AuroraDataApiPostgresDriver' is not exported from './postgres/PostgresDriver'.

> Build error occurred
Error: > Build failed because of webpack errors
    at build (/Users/alex/code/my-project/node_modules/next/dist/build/index.js:13:917)
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```
Here's my `/api/auth/[...nextauth].js`
```js
import NextAuth from 'next-auth'
import Providers from 'next-auth/providers'
import adapter from 'next-auth/adapters'


const options = {
  site: process.env.SITE || 'http://localhost:3000',

  // Configure one or more authentication providers
  providers: [
    Providers.Twitter({
      clientId: process.env.TWITTER_ID,
      clientSecret: process.env.TWITTER_SECRET
    }),
    // Sign in with passwordless email link
    Providers.Email({
      server: process.env.MAIL_SERVER,
      from: 'noreply@my-project.com'
    }),
  ],
  callbacks: {
    session: async (session, user) => {
      const { getUserByEmail } = await adapter.Default({}).getAdapter()
      const { id } = await getUserByEmail(session.user.email)
      session.user.id = id
      return session
    }
  },

  // A database is optional, but required to persist accounts in a database
  database: process.env.USER_DB_URL,
}

export default (req, res) => NextAuth(req, res, options)
```
**To Reproduce**
`next build`

**Expected behavior**
When running locally, everything seems to work. I added `NEXTAUTH_URL="https://my-project-alexcory.my-project.vercel.app"` to the `.env`. Any ideas?

I just found https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/issues/6110 and looks like it's from `typeorm@0.2.25`. Maybe switch from `typeorm@^0.2.24` to `typeorm@0.2.24` in `package.json`?

body:
I am still getting this error:

`Failed to compile.
D:/project/xyz/node_modules/typeorm/browser/driver/DriverFactory.js
Attempted import error: 'AuroraDataApiPostgresDriver' is not exported from './postgres/PostgresDriver'.`

I am on the latest version (yarn add typeorm@latest => "typeorm": "^0.2.25").
Package.json version inside my node_modules typeorm folder:
`{
  "name": "typeorm",
  "private": false,
  "version": "0.2.25",`

> I am still getting this error:
> 
> I am on the latest version (yarn add typeorm@latest => "typeorm": "^0.2.25").

That's still the version with the error. Unfortunately typeorm hasn't released a new version yet.

> > I am still getting this error:
> > I am on the latest version (yarn add typeorm@latest => "typeorm": "^0.2.25").
> 
> That's still the version with the error. Unfortunately typeorm hasn't released a new version yet.

Ah yes I see now in the related #6117 there is a patch that can be applied for now. Thanks for your help!
